text: Mamdouh Mohammed Hassan Elssbiay (; born 16 September 1984), also known as Big Ramy, is an Egyptian IFBB Pro professional bodybuilder. Known for his size and conditioning,https://thegymgoat.com/big-ramy/ he is a two time Mr. Olympia champion, winning in 2020 and 2021. Born in Kafr El Sheikh, Elssbiay started to train professionally as a bodybuilder in 2009 after moving to Kuwait. He eventually earned his pro card by winning the overall title at the 2012 Amateur Olympia in Kuwait City. In 2013, he made his IFBB Pro-debut at the New York Pro, which he won. He won the Arnold Classic Brazil in 2015, becoming the first Egyptian to win the title.https://egyptianstreets.com/2015/06/03/arnold- shwarzenegger-honors-big-ramy-as-first-egyptian-winner-of-prestigious- bodybuilding-competition/ In 2020, he became the first Egyptian bodybuilder to win the Mr. Olympia title, the second Middle Eastern bodybuilder to win after Lebanese Samir Bannout in 1983, and the first non-American since British champion Dorian Yates in 1997.https://www.gqmiddleeast.com/culture/big-ramy- mamdouh-elssbiay-arab-wins-mr-olympia-2020https://www.newarab.com/news/egypts- big-ramy-crowned-mr-olympia-second-year?amp ==References== Category:1984 births Category:Living people Category:Egyptian sportspeople Category:Bodybuilders
title: Mamdouh Elssbiay
